Unbalanced with a lack of direction, lots of meta shifting, character reworks and rebalances over the years, quantity over quality; rigid and clunky movement mechanics that enable limited verticality and reduce the skill ceiling, with everything tied to cooldowns; poor visual cohesion and legibility; full of microtransactions; false promises; an overly sanitized and unorganic "competitive scene" completely unmanaged by its community; zero mod support.
The game can look great on screenshots and renders, but its gameplay is the most disappointing and offensive aspect that I can think of when talking about first person shooters in general.
Them having to release this so called "sequel" here on Steam gives me hope for the future of the games industry. The fact that the 15 year old game it was supposed to kill or replace still has a healthy playerbase shows us that good gameplay, good artstyle and visual cohesion and community involvement go a long long way.

Alright here's the guide on how to play Overwatch 2.
Don't click install.
Scroll down and on the right you'll see "view discussions"
Click that.
Now click on the Artwork tab and enjoy Overwatch for what it is.

Overwatch 2 had the potential to be a game-changing sequel, but it falls flat on its face as a shameless cash grab that prioritizes profits over player experience. The promises made by Blizzard have turned out to be nothing more than hollow marketing tactics designed to drain wallets rather than provide a genuinely enjoyable gaming experience.

One of the most glaring issues with Overwatch 2 is its unbalanced hero roster. Despite the claims of improved balance, the game introduces new heroes without addressing the glaring imbalances that have plagued the original Overwatch. This shows a complete lack of commitment to fair competition and is a slap in the face to players who have invested time and money into mastering certain heroes, only to have their efforts invalidated by overpowered newcomers.

But what truly makes Overwatch 2 a frustrating experience is its nearly unplayable matchmaking system. Blizzard promised improvements in this department, yet players still find themselves in lopsided matches that suck the fun out of the game. Whether it's facing off against a team with significantly higher skill levels or being placed on a team of clueless beginners, the matchmaking algorithm is a mockery of balanced gameplay.

Perhaps the most disappointing aspect of Overwatch 2 is its blatant cash-grab tactics. The game is riddled with microtransactions, loot boxes, and other money-grabbing mechanics that undermine the integrity of the gameplay. Blizzard seems more interested in monetizing every aspect of the game than delivering a polished and immersive experience to its players. The exorbitant prices for cosmetics and the constant barrage of "limited-time" offers reek of greed and a lack of respect for the player base.

Furthermore, the release of Overwatch 2 as a separate title rather than a significant update to the original game feels like a calculated move to extract more money from fans. Rather than building on the existing player community, Blizzard seems intent on fragmenting it and coercing players to open their wallets once again for what should have been a more seamless transition.

In conclusion, Overwatch 2 is a disappointing sequel that fails to live up to its promises. Its unbalanced hero roster, unplayable matchmaking, and money-driven approach make it abundantly clear that Blizzard's priorities lie in profiting at the expense of player enjoyment. What could have been an exciting evolution of a beloved game has turned out to be a cynical example of the worst practices in the gaming industry. Save your money and play  Team Fortress 2 â€“ it's a better option than supporting this cash grab.

I had roughly 2800 hours in Overwatch 1 when it ended and was just under Masters rank. Overwatch was the first fps game I got into competitively, it gave me the enjoyment I got from league of legends heroes system in a more fast paced and fun environment. Overwatch imo never had the greatest ranked system, balance team, or matchmaking (LoL did a much better job), but it was still a game I could take seriously competitively and over time your skill did put you in the rank you belonged. Overwatch 2 threw that all out the window. The game has lost all competitive integrity. Matchmaking is worse, balance team is worse, it gets FAR more bugs than OW1 ever did, Blizzard boosted 40% of low rank players to fill out the less populated higher ranks, and 5v5 causes severe role imbalance and breaks the tank role.

I want this review to focus on the game itself so letâ€™s get this out of the way nowâ€¦ the monetization is the worst in the competitive live service genre. That should come as no surpriseâ€¦it is after all, Activision/Blizz. Moving on. 

[u]From 6v6 to 5v5[/u]

As a tank main, I was optimistic about 5v5. Having all the power of the tank role in my hands sounded awesome to me. Turns out it sucksâ€¦really bad. Overwatch was built to function in a way where every role (tank, dps, and support) enabled another role, and nobody could really do their job if they werenâ€™t being efficiently enabled by another role. Tank was the hardest role in OW1 but the value you could provide was tremendous. Tanks enabled dps by taking space, and supports by peeling. By peeling you directly enabled your supports which is the role that enables tanks by healing them through all the damage they soak. Tanks controlled the flow of the game. They pressured front lines, back lines and peeled for supports. 5v5 removed a tank from each team and this resulted in tanks that just canâ€™t really do the job they were built to do. There is a downside to every decision a tank makes. It is fundamentally a broken role. 

If you pressure backline, you leave the opposing tank to run on your team. If you peel for your supports, on many tanks you just get CCâ€™d, debuffed, shot in the back and annihilated. If you pressure front line, youâ€™re really just feeding support ults because supports are insanely strong now and have crazy high healing numbers. This results in a bunch of low IQ players saying â€œtank diffâ€ that expect the tank to always be doing something theyâ€™re not. Since thereâ€™s a downside to every decision a tank makes, stupid people get toxic towards the tank because the downside happened. 

Since tanks canâ€™t really peel anymore, they had to megabuff the support role so they could fight off the dps flanking them. Now we have supports that are literally just dps with better abilities that keep them alive and provide powerful utility. 

In OW1 every role was pretty balanced in comparison to each other. In OW2 support is OP, dps is great, tank sucks. 

Tanks suck because itâ€™s so incredibly easy to negate the role by hard countering it. Itâ€™s a lot easier to switch to hard counter 1 person than it is to switch to hard counter 2 people. For example in OW1 if the opposing team had a good Hog player, someone would switch to Ana to counter the Hog but then Hogs tank team mate would switch to Dva to counter the Ana. It just made countering balanced as there was always a way to lessen the impact it has, and if someone switched to counter 1 tank, they likely werenâ€™t countering the other tank. Not so much in OW2â€¦tanks are hit hard by counters. Tanking in diamond + in OW2 is literally just constantly switching to avoid 5 people switching to hard counter you ALL THE TIME. Itâ€™s obnoxious as hell. On top of that, itâ€™s meta to throw discord on the tank which makes them take 30% more damage from all sources, all forms of CC will be thrown at the tank, and the moronic balance team just keeps increasing the amount of damage dps and supports do just to make playing tank even worse than it already is. All of this makes tanking a pain in the ass to play and the game is seemingly in the largest tank player shortage weâ€™ve ever seen, with competitive tank queues at 5-15 seconds while everything else is several minutes, and players saying that when a tank leaves their quick play game they donâ€™t even get a backfill tank a lot of times because so few people are queuing for it. 


[u]Matchmaking and Competitive mode[/u]

In OW1 comp tank queues were 1 minute, dps queues were 10 minutes+, Support queues were around 4 minutes. This was just due to role popularity but matchmaking was fairly balancedâ€¦enough for a solo queuer to climb with. OW2 Season 1 we were seeing 10+ minute tank queues, 4 minute dps queues, and 1 minute support queues. Same matchmaking as OW1 but role popularities had shifted around. OW2 Season 2 suddenly weâ€™re seeing 1 minute queue times across the board. Hmmmm how did this happen?? People who examined profiles of their team mates (since blizzard decided to hide everyones ranks in attempt to cover this up), found that they were getting Bronze players in their Diamond games and Gold players in their Grandmaster games. The skill gaps were just MASSIVE and turned comp mode into a complete jokeâ€¦so the community complained as expected and how Blizzard handled this just blew my mind. This really goes to show just how low Blizz has fallen.

In Seasons 3 and 4 there were dev updates that stated they improved matchmaking. Matchmaking appeared to be getting better. We were seeing far less skill gaps in our matchmaking and by Season 4 it was pretty much goneâ€¦on the surface at least. Blizzard fooled many people by doing this, but what was actually happening was Blizzard boosted random low rank players to fill out the less populated higher ranks in order to retain the fast queue times. Proof https://imgur.com/a/giNMqas

That link shows someone who was a Gold support player all through OW1, never played enough to even place in Seasons 1 & 2 of OW2, S3 they were Gold, and S4 they placed DIAMOND for winning TWO games. The last pic shows their win rate percentages with support heroes in S4 at 21%, 19%, and 17%. This person literally skipped over THE ENTIRE PLATINUM RANK FOR LOSING. During the time this screen shot was taken, I was seeing this kind of stuff in EVERY SINGLE GAME. There was always some garbage players that just stuck out obviously boosted and when examining their profile, it confirmed they were boosted. The worst one I saw was a tank player that was silver in all of OW1 and OW2 until S3 they moved from Silver to MASTERS for winning 9 games . Thatâ€™s a climb that would have taken an over 40 game winning streak in OW1. I tank diffed this guy so hard everyone reported him as throwing but I knew he was one of the random chosen to be boosted lol. 

So essentially, OW2 is still putting Bronze players in Diamond games and Gold players in GM games. The only difference is the Bronze player now has a Diamond badge and the Gold player now has a GM badge. This has completely killed competitive. Itâ€™s just simply not a competitive system anymore, itâ€™s a casual quick play mode with medals. 


[u]Balance[/u]

Honestly it doesnâ€™t even seem like these guys are trying to balance the game anymore, it seems like theyâ€™re just trying to force metas and of course they keep all the new heroes OP so new players will buy them. 
This new balance team is awful. Theyâ€™ve tried to nerf heroes and accidentally buff them, theyâ€™ve said â€œitâ€™s okay that this hero is OP cause sheâ€™s not OP in Goldâ€, showing that theyâ€™re now balancing for casuals? They just added more CC to the game and more damage to make playing tank even more miserable. GM/Top 500 Overwatch content creators always give great feedback and balance suggestions but itâ€™s always ignored. This team just does whatever they want to the game and ignore all community feedback. If they actually listened to the players, we wouldnâ€™t have this garbage 5v5 in the first place.

This game used to be great when it first came out. My friends and I have put countless hours this game for the first two years of its life. Then it progressively got worse as time went on. Balance patches were inconsistent. Dive meta for SO LONG. GOATS META. Then we have role queue. It is not bad but i do miss being able to switch from tank to dps to healer because my teammate is bad at the game. At the end of Overwatch 1 this game was left in the dust for Overwatch 2! Hooray! SIKE THEY JUST WANT YOUR WALLET. Old/new skins costing too much money. I've earned every skin I own for free. Now I have to pay to blizzard money with an overpriced skin? Ridiculous. New heroes in the battle pass instead of it being free like in Overwatch 1. If the new heroes are meta and you don't have them because you didnt buy the premium battle pass or did not have enough time to play to earn it for free reaching tier like 50 then good luck playing ranked and I know the new heroes are disabled in ranked for 2 weeks but not everyone has time to grind to tier 50 to unlock the new heroes for free. Overwatch 2 is also a 5v5 now. They couldnt fix the double shield meta FOR 3 YEARS or the game was too fast-paced so its 5v5 now. You like playing duo tank with your buddy like I did, too bad. No more rein zarya, winston dva, orisa hog, etc. All gone. Upsetting. Only 1 tank per team. Then ranking system in this game is also terrible. They did a recalibration of the ranks and everyone got boosted up to masters/grandmasters in 1 ranked season. They just handed it out high ranks for free and im stuck playing with player who most of them do not belong there. Sojourn was OP when she first came out and the samething with Kiriko and Ramatra. AND they still took TOO LONG to do any balance patches. Unbelievable. Then the campaign we were promised. What were they working on for 3 years? Honestly I dont even know but now they want to charge us a campaign full of things we are not getting with the replay ability with the skill trees and everything. Its just not the same. Lying to us the whole time knowing they could not fulfill their promise to us for the campaign. Just disrespectful. I understand Blizzard is not too fully blame its also Activsion and their corrupt company. Money hungry scumbags. I want this game to succeed and thrive like how it was in 2016 but I dont think that will ever happen. New players, sure try it out but don't expect to be blown away or to be disappointed when blizzard messes up again. As for old veteran players like me, I hate the path Overwatch has went down. I will play it here in there for nostalgia and for my favorite heroes but thats it. Blizzard/Activision killed Overwatch for most of the old players.
